items.text: I feel a rush of energy when I start a new project.
items.rationale: Feeling energized and excited is a key aspect of high arousal.

items.text: He often talks rapidly and gestures a lot when he's excited.
items.rationale: Rapid speech and gesturing are behaviors associated with high arousal.

items.text: I find it hard to sit still when I'm enthusiastic about something.
items.rationale: Difficulty sitting still is indicative of high arousal.

items.text: She often feels restless and eager to move.
items.rationale: Restlessness and eagerness are signs of high arousal.

items.text: I get a thrill from taking on new challenges.
items.rationale: Thrill-seeking is a characteristic of high arousal.

items.text: He always seems to be on the go, never slowing down.
items.rationale: Constant activity is a hallmark of high arousal.

items.text: I feel alive and vibrant when I'm in a stimulating environment.
items.rationale: Feeling alive and vibrant in stimulating settings indicates high arousal.

items.text: She thrives in fast-paced situations.
items.rationale: Thriving in fast-paced situations is a sign of high arousal.

items.text: I often feel a surge of adrenaline in exciting moments.
items.rationale: Adrenaline surges are associated with high arousal.

items.text: He gets animated when discussing his passions.
items.rationale: Becoming animated is a behavior linked to high arousal.

items.text: I love the feeling of being fully engaged and alert.
items.rationale: Being fully engaged and alert is characteristic of high arousal.

items.text: She often feels a buzz of excitement in social gatherings.
items.rationale: Feeling a buzz of excitement is indicative of high arousal.

items.text: I sometimes feel overwhelmed by too much excitement.
items.rationale: Feeling overwhelmed can indicate high arousal but also relates to stress.

items.text: He occasionally finds it hard to relax even when he wants to.
items.rationale: Difficulty relaxing suggests high arousal but could also relate to anxiety.

items.text: I feel a mix of excitement and anxiety before big events.
items.rationale: Excitement maps to arousal, but anxiety could relate to negative valence.

items.text: I often feel content and satisfied with my life.
items.rationale: Contentment and satisfaction are key indicators of positive valence.

items.text: She usually has a cheerful and optimistic outlook.
items.rationale: Cheerfulness and optimism are associated with positive valence.

items.text: I frequently experience joy in everyday activities.
items.rationale: Experiencing joy regularly is a sign of positive valence.

items.text: He tends to see the bright side of things.
items.rationale: Seeing the bright side is indicative of positive valence.

items.text: I feel grateful for the good things in my life.
items.rationale: Gratitude is a component of positive valence.

items.text: She often expresses happiness and satisfaction.
items.rationale: Expressing happiness and satisfaction is linked to positive valence.

items.text: I generally have a positive attitude towards life.
items.rationale: A positive attitude is a core aspect of positive valence.

items.text: He finds joy in helping others.
items.rationale: Finding joy in altruism is a sign of positive valence.

items.text: I often feel a sense of peace and well-being.
items.rationale: Peace and well-being are indicative of positive valence.

items.text: She radiates positivity and warmth.
items.rationale: Radiating positivity and warmth is characteristic of positive valence.

items.text: I feel uplifted by the beauty around me.
items.rationale: Feeling uplifted by beauty is a sign of positive valence.

items.text: He often feels a deep sense of satisfaction after completing tasks.
items.rationale: Satisfaction can indicate positive valence but may also relate to achievement.

items.text: I sometimes feel a quiet happiness that isn't very intense.
items.rationale: Quiet happiness suggests positive valence but lacks intensity.

items.text: I feel both happy and energized when I'm with friends.
items.rationale: Happiness maps to valence, but energy could relate to arousal.
